intro: Lotononis lenticula var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-seeded lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its small, rounded pods contain seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
